title.native: クラスルーム☆クライシス

description:
A romantic comedy set in a near-futuristic world about the troubles and tribulations of high schoolers on salary. With aims to one day reach out into the stars, humanity has colonized all the planets of the solar system. This story of young high school hopefuls is set in Fourth Tokyo in a Japanese Martian prefecture. Iris Shirasaki is a third year student/aspiring test pilot. Mizuki Sera is her peer/mechanic and Mizuki's brother Kaito is their homeroom teacher and the young director of the program developing their talents.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanzakihiro) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLww4xTaLWjpESsK2HzkkcA) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/1159685/mylist?ref=pc_userpage_menu) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/27557) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/user-658062794)

Animator, illustrator and composer.

Uses the pen name Hanasoumen-P (鼻そうめんP) or HSP for his Vocaloid work.
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/F_Maruto_staff)

He is the original scenario writer for the visual novel White Album 2.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

__[Website](http://www.clarismusic.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ClariS_Staff)__ | __[Artist Page (Sacra Music)](https://sacramusic.jp/artist/#claris)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ClariSofficial)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-zeaPnxZHE3EcTyVl1fTdw)__

__Formed:__ 2009
__Genres:__ J-POP, Synthpop, Pop rock, Anison

__Biography:__
ClariS is a Japanese singing group under record label [Sacra Music](https://sacramusic.jp/) (2017-), having previously been under [SME Records](https://www.sme.co.jp/s/SME/company/SML?ima=3832) (2010-2017) the group consisted of two high school girls who gained popularity through the video sharing site Nico Nico Douga as “アリス☆クララ" ("Alice☆Clara") in 2009 and 2010. They have since changed their name to “ClariS” for their major debut in 2010, which means “sunny, clean and bright” in Latin. Since they were still high school students and wanted to focus on their school studies, they would not reveal their identities. Therefore, they would only be shown as illustrations. They both started their high school education in April 2012, according to their official Twitter.  When drawn, Clara is depicted wearing pink items, and Alice is shown wearing blue items. Images of the crescent moon are used as a motif to represent Clara, and the sun is used to represent Alice, which comes from their personal preferences. Clara is shown with slightly wavy hair and no bangs, while Alice is drawn with straight hair with bangs.

In 2014, Alice left ClariS to focus on her studies. Clara was then joined by her friend Karen whom she met when they were classmates at the same music school. When drawn, Karen is depicted wearing pastel green items, and images of stars are used to represent her.

On the 1st September 2024, ClariS Karen announced her graduation after ClariS AUTUMN TOUR 2024.

__Members:__
- Clara (クララ) (2009-)
- Ellie (エリー) (2025-)
- Anna (アンナ) (2025-)

__Former Members:__
- Alice (アリス) (2009-2014)
- Karen (カレン) (2014-2024)
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).

__[Website](https://www.yuasastudio.com/profile.html)__

__Atsushi Yuasa__ is a Japanese sound producer, arranger and sound programmer.

[Website](http://koh777.wixsite.com/koh-website) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/K_O_H777)

KOH is a lyricist, composer and arranger.

[Website](http://koh777.wixsite.com/koh-website) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/K_O_H777)

KOH is a lyricist, composer and arranger.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KeigoKoya)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/F_Maruto_staff)

He is the original scenario writer for the visual novel White Album 2.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomoki_kyoda/)

Influenced by Hiroyuki Nakano's commercials and music videos, he studied video art at the Musashino Art University, joining Gento Matsumoto's company Sal Brunei as a graphic designer. He soon changed his occupation to the animation industry, having aspired to be an animation director since his childhood. 

He initially joined [Group TAC](https://anilist.co/studio/86/Group-TAC) where he worked as episode director and storyboard artist under the guidance of [Mitsuru Hongou](https://anilist.co/staff/103366/Mitsuru-Hongou). His first major role was as mechanical/creature designer on [Chikyuu Bouei Kazoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1962/The-Daichis--Earths-Defense-Family/), working alongside [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/Shouji-Kawamori) and [Kazutaka Miyatake](https://anilist.co/staff/100987/Kazutaka-Miyatake), with whom he would collaborate profusely afterwards. 

He later moved to studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/bones) landing as assistant director for [Yutaka Izubuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99075/Yutaka-Izubuchi)'s [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/RahXephon/). The two became close collaborators, with Kyouda soon taking the leading role on the [RahXephon: Pluralitas Concentio](https://anilist.co/anime/758/RahXephon-The-Motion-Picture/) movie.

Soon after, he directed [Eureka Seven](https://anilist.co/anime/237/Eureka-Seven/), incorporating his love for music and different sub-cultures into mecha anime.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/imozuka) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E9%87%8E%E8%81%A1)

Satoshi Ishino is a Japanese animator, animation supervisor, character/mechanical designer and animation director.

He started working at Studio Giants, but later went to work at Studio Fantasia before becoming a freelance animator. Today he is a part of the animator group Studio Hercules (スタジオへらくれす), and he's also a part of the doujin circle TEAM Imozuka (TEAM いもずか).

Satoshi is best known for his work as a character designer and animation supervisor in the show Excel Saga and the related Puni Puni Poemi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanzakihiro) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLww4xTaLWjpESsK2HzkkcA) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/1159685/mylist?ref=pc_userpage_menu) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/27557) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/user-658062794)
